Reviews.Title: “Room NOT clean”
Reviews.Author: Paulus S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for many years when I was in Amsterdam for business when it was still called Tulip Inn. This time it was a big disappointment. There were long black hairs in the shower cabin which were not cleaned during my two nights stay. There were also hairs on the bed. The drain of the sink was blocked with dirt and the safe was locked by the previous guest. No spoons available near the yoghurt during breakfast, bad taste orange juice from the machine, no water in the fitness room. Many things to improve!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, a bit far a way”
Reviews.Author: SRODO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Amsterdam City West for 4 nights, for a short holiday to the city. For the price, the hotel is very nice and the rooms are clean. The staff on the front desk are very nice and helpful, they are a little bit ruder in the restaurant during the morning breakfast. The biggest disadvantage would have to be the distance, about a 25/30 minute tram trip from the centre of the city which is easy to do, but nevertheless a little bit far. The neighbourhood also seemed a bit sketchy but possibly that was because there were no tourists and it seemed a bit industrial. I would recommend it to people who don't want to pay much for what is really a clean and nice hotel and don't mind making the trip out to the hotel. It can be a disadvantage at night time with trams ending around midnight (something we found very annoying).

Reviews.Title: “Schooltrip”
Reviews.Author: Camilla D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and big(family room), and the beds were comfortable. A downside - the beds were not maid even if we put the sign on the door. Hotelbreakfast was expensive, so we went to the supermarket and McDonalds which was a 15 min walk. The location of the hotel was a bit far from the city, it took about 30 min to get to central station. But it was not difficult to get in. The bus stop was just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: JOSE ANGEL C
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience in Amsterdam. This hotel is located in the outskirts of Amsterdam. The surrounding neighborhood is clearly unsafe. From the outside it looked like an old hotel, but as we entered our room the bedding was very clean and the bathroom was spotless. Used towels were replaced daily. NEGATIVE NOTES: Most of the staff was rude and unfriendly, with complete disregard of their guest, specially the manager on charge at the time. We booked for a two night stay. They offered dry cleaning services. On our first night I payed for this service. The staff at the front desk told me that I will recieve my clean clothes the next day. I clearly specify the lady on the front desk that we were only staying for 2 nights and that I needed to be sure to receive the next day service and she told me there will be no problems. (They never told me that the laundry service was out of the premises at car driving distance.) My clothes were never delivered and the only answer I received was that the dry clean service was close at that time and I had to wait till the next day, and I was leaving the hotel at 6am the next morning. I asked for the manager and his answer was that the dry clean service was closed. I lost my clothes and the manager didn't want to cover my loss. I asked if there was any insurance to cover this incidents and he never answered. I had to engage in an unpleasant argument with this man, on which as a client I had the reason. Finally in a very hostile manner and after my tourguide intervene, the manager gave me 50 euros from his pocket and told me that that was all he can gave me for my loss. This was a very unpleasant and embarassing situation. Definitely customer satisfaction is NOT a priority for this manager. I definitely will never stay in this hotel again and never will recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: El G
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: Tulip Inn-Amsterdam West is a three star hotel located in a residential neighborhood on the outskirts of Amsterdam. My wife and I stayed there on outbound back to the US after exploring Europe because of its close proximity to Amsterdam Airport. We needed one day to relax before concluding our European trip. Itâ€™s has all the basic necessity of a European three star hotel, including horrible customer service. Furthermore, this particular hotel is located in a disreputable neighborhood. Most of the staff was rude and unfriendly, with complete disregard of their guest. Good thing we only stayed there overnight. TRAVEL DATES: September-2009 LOCATION: Located within a ten minute cab ride to Amsterdam Schiphol Airport. Approximately 45 minutes to the City Center via City Tram. The residential neighborhood in the hotel vicinity doesnâ€™t look safe overall. Not really the type of neighborhood to take leisure walk at night. POSITIVE NOTES: Located close to Amsterdam Schiphol Airport. NEGATIVE NOTES: Iâ€™ve lived in Europe for three years; therefore, Iâ€™m aware of European customer service standard. This hotel however, surpasses that standard. Customer satisfaction is NOT a priority. Surrounding neighborhood is clearly unsafe. They can tell a tourist from a mile away. No in-room safe to store our passports. Outrageous hidden charges. AMENITIES: Continental breakfast; Wi-Fi Access; Coffee Maker; Hairdryer; Clock/Radio; On-Site Restaurant. NIGHTLY RATE: $85+ Booked via Cheaprooms.com DISCOUNT ACCEPTED: None NOTES: Please click the green â€œYESâ€� button below if you find this review helpful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a hostel price”
Reviews.Author: MartynG_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week at the Remco Amsterdam City West. Found a great price for my stay and the hotel proved to be good. I was allocated a large room with a large double bed which for a solo traveller is a nice touch. Free wifi in the room worked perfectly. The hotel is reached by tram 17 to Hoekenes (30 minutes) tram stop and then its a 5 minute walk. Also the tram and bus 63 runs near the hotel to Station Leylaan for connections to Schipol. The hotel is located on a large housing development and those arriving at night need to be aware of this and take care but no more than you would in any large city as a new arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Remco Hotel formerly known as Tulip Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Since the hotel is not a member anymore from the Tulip Chain (Golden Tulip/Tulip Inn), the staff and service is not very well and the room were hairs in the bed and bathroom and white towels with orange spots on it. It clearly is a low budget hotel now and dated furniture and filthy curtains. Sorry to say but i will not stay there anymore. Were here earlier twice when it still was a Tulip Hotel and then it was much better and not loud youth Don't let the photo fool you, it is not a member of the Tulip Hotel Chain anymore!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dana C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,with really big rooms for the money you pay.Very nice and helpfull staff.A really good deal! Not so far from the city center.Tram 17 it is really fast,aproximatelly 25 min to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed at knifepoint”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTourist_33
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Tulip Inn in Osdorp (west end) in December 2011 after a miss booking for the Tulip in the centre and we were robbed by a man with a kitchen knife at 5pm 200 yards from the hotel entrance. Not only that but get off a late bus or tram and they'll be waiting to rob tourists as they get off at the stop nearest the hotel. DO NOT STAY AT THE TULIP IN OSDORP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Holidays In Amsterdam City Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: touf-touf
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 16nights last December me and my wife.Our arrival there was early in the morning around 08.00.The woman from reception gave us the key card for our room earlier than 14.00(check-in time). The room was large and very confortable too.There was a twin double bed with very soft mattress. Also Tv and big windows.Bathroom was also large but not in very good situattion for example no heating.Aboutt the services in this hotel cleanning must be made better. Very good restaurant also in resonable prices. Also heating in the room didn't work and they gave us a small heater but very small. I think they need a renovation in afew points especialy into to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doozey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times when over in Amsterdam. Its located close to the office, but cant comment on how easy it is to get into Amsterdam from there as we havent tried it. The hotel is very clean and spacious with reasonable prices too. Sometimes you can get caught up in coach loads of tourists checking in or out but generally its a good sign if the hotel is busy, I think. The food is limited in the bar but the staff are always helpful in directing you to somewhere to aget a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Travel in Amsterdam last august”
Reviews.Author: Minatas
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was in Amsterdam last august. I spent 4 wonderful days in the hotel Tulip Inn, Amsterdam City West. The hotel was chosen according on reviews of Trip Adviser. Everting, the hotel, atmosphere, attractions in Amsterdam were fine and I thank you for all information you had provided me by site. I am planing to visit Istanbul next march. I hope the Trip Adviser will be useful in the future travel like before.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: LovTravelOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of the Cosmos tour. The hotel provide good service, spacious room . The breakfast is good too. Tram is nearby but did not try it, so cannot comment.Free wi-fi Other people in the tour group said they have an electric kettle in their room but not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Molly O
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here, arrived late at night & was delighted in every way, the room was great & comfortable . Cleaned everyday with fresh towels. Good facilities, was able to purchase transport card for the tram/metro for 3 days from reception.(15.50 euro) . Not too far from the airport, (which was good for my return early am flight) upon arrival to save on expensive taxi's, for 3.50 euro from Sciphol I took inter city/ or service train to station Lelylaan ( 7 mins) then tram 17(right outside station) 10 min ride. the walk to the hotel is fine, passing a lovely canal with wildlife, & a park, the area seemed nice. The tram into the centre takes about 20 mins which was fine for me. Did not take breakfast here, went to one of the many places on Prisengracht for coffee. Good value for money this hotel. Will stay here again on my next visit to A'dam

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 4 nights (Oct. 26-30) and found the hotel to be very decent overall: the room was spacious, the bathroom quite clean, towels were changed on a daily basis, the staff were friendly and helpful. Despite the appreciable distance to the city centre (30-35 minutes), trams ran very often and the ride was pleasant. Breakfast was served until 10:30 (something certainly desirable for late-risers like ourselves) and was good and plenty. On the negative side, there were a few things that a picky person could complain about (such as the noise of closing doors or the "do not disturb" signs which kept falling off) but the one important negative comment we would like to make concerns the rug in the room: it smelled pretty bad, to the point that when we first arrived and entered the room we thought someone had been smoking inside for days (and all this in a non-smoking hotel). Something has to be done about this- it casts a shadow on an otherwise very decent hotel. Overall, a good hotel and very reasonably priced compared to other Amsterdam hotels which are closer to the city centre. We would certainly consider staying there if we found ourselves in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Booking Dissappiontment”
Reviews.Author: pakatom
Reviews.Content: After first booking 4 nights at this hotel i recieved detalis saying my visa details are not correct . Other hotels accepted my details. I therefore called the hotel to check whether everything is ok and they confirmed my booking was 100% safe. Upon arrival i called once again and the hotel confirmed i had a safe booking. Ultimately when arriving at the hotel i was informed there was a small hitch in the hotel system kso i would have to be transferred to another hotel 4 km further out of the city. i mean how irresponsible and greedy. they new from the start they had now place but still they try to fool you into going just to seal the deal maybe with an accomplice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and reasobaly priced by AMS standard”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Last week, I stayed in two different rooms (3 nights in one and 1 night in other) of this hotel. During my stay, I found the Hotel to be very good. Best thing I liked is that it offers a free parking. This means one does not have to pay additionally. This hotel has decent sized rooms, even by Amsterdam standard. Room has all basics that you find in Europe, except for mini-bar. From amenities perspective, it has a restaurant and gym as well. Location wise, I did not find any issues and found this within 10 km of Amsterdam Central. I did not try the public transport, so I cannot comment about accessibility. Also, staff was welcoming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, recommended for longer stays over 2 days!!”
Reviews.Author: CLGonthemove
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with three friends in August for a two day trip to Amsterdam. On the way to the hotel, the taxi turned into the neighborhood and i instantly though OMG! (we passed a building with windows that had been smashed). However although the hotel is located in the suburbs, I have to say that the area was quite quiet most of the time. The hotel itself was very nice, and clean with plenty of space. The restaurant/ bar staff and the food was very nice within the hotel, and not too expensive either. The only downside was the tram journey into Amsterdam center. This took 40 mins, plus another 10 min walk to the tram line. This is fine when staying for a few days or a week, but as we were only there two days and had early morning flights it did take it out of us a bit!!!. Overall, a lovely hotel and would probably stay there again if staying for a longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Cayeninc
Reviews.Content: It is out of the hustle and bustle of the city centre, which was nice for us, early thirties travellers. Basic. No tea and coffee making facilities or fridge, mini bar. Wifi was a bit dodgy. All in all good value for money, hotels are on the whole very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: c4you2
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam at the beginning of July for the purpose of being a part of the Sensation White (2nd of July) event. This hotel seemed a reasonable balance between the prices in Amsterdam and the quality they can offer. We were not disappointed at all: the room was clean and the daily cleaning was impressive. Even though our room was at the top floor, they have 2 elevators, so no worries about that. The neighborhood is really quiet, there's a Lidl at 300 or 400 m from the hotel, by the tram lines. Getting to Central station took us between 30 to 40 minutes by tram, which is not much. We did meet a moody weather, really cold nights, but as it turned out, they heating system in the hotel was turned on during those cold nights. One can lend a bicycle from the hotel, cheaper than doing it from Central Station or other parts. We enjoyed our staying at this hotel and I would recommend it, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sf2011_11
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Big family room. free WIFI. No fridge in the room/ Very far from city center (about an hour using a tram)

Reviews.Title: “simple but does the job”
Reviews.Author: alice_q
Reviews.Content: the place is pretty basic but clean and orderly. it's a bit too far from the center, and although the nearby subway station compensates, the station itself is about 10 min walk away from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “i stayed in room 106 its massive and very nice”
Reviews.Author: mrhardy_11
Reviews.Content: i would recommend this hotel the breakfast is not really for english but overall its good the room i had was very large although it needs a lick of paint it was very clean the metro is only a ten minute walk and costs 11.50euro's for 48hrs worth of travel and that includes the bus service

Reviews.Title: “Time for a good clean and refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Aussiedave73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located for us, so we really only stay here for that reason. The experience is generally comfortable however over the last 5 years it's condition and standards have really detiorated. The rooms are the biggest disappointment. Our family room was not clean, with hair on the floors in bedroom and bathroom, mould in the corners of bath which also didn't drain properly. The room walls, fittings and furniture was worn and marked or stained. A few of the towels were also marked with stains and all were very thin. The rooms didn't have a basic kettle, glasses or facilities for a drink. On the upside, the hotel staff are friendly and there is free WiFi throughout the hotel. Would only recommend you stay here if you need to.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap! And that's about it”
Reviews.Author: floydanubhav
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly. Wasn't exactly super cheap but it was the cheapest place i found to crash last minute. Would I stay here again. I doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Fiyat-performans orani iyi :)”
Reviews.Author: pief77
Reviews.Content: Oncelikle otelin cok super olmadigi soylemeliyim. Odalar bayagi genis ve refah. Ama temizlik cok da iyi degildi. Ama cok da kotu degildi. Acikcasi temizlik bana iyi geldi ama esim pek begenmedi :) Otelin en guzel yani ise otelin mevkisinin Turklerin yasadigi mevkinin tam ortasinda olmasi. Bu bizim acimizdan pozitif oldu, cunku Amsterdam'da hic yabancilik yasamadik, sanki evimizde gibiydik :) Otelin hemen yakininda bir suru Turk restaurant, market ve firin bulunmaktaydi. Bu sayede yiyecek ve icecek sorununu rahatlikla cozduk. Cogunlukla bizim gittigimiz ulkelerde yasadigimiz sorunlarin en buyugu uygun yemek yiyecek yer bulamamak oluyordu. Bu otelin mevkisi ise bu nedenle bize cok uygun geldi. Ama ayni zamanda sehirden bayagi uzakta, bu nedenle bu oteli sececekseniz bunu goze alarak gitmelisiniz. Tramvay ile merkeze inmesi yarim saati buluyor. Ben Amsterdam'a gidecek bir Turke rahatlikla bu oteli tavsiye edebilirim. Hic yabancilik cekmezsiniz, hatta eviniz gibi rahat.. Ayrica soylemeliyim ki Amsterdam'da yasayanlarlar gayet guzel ve anlasilir Ingilizce konusuyorlar. Bu da sehir icin arti bir ozellik.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, except for the staff”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTrotster
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and the location is ok as far as being between the airport and downtown Amsterdam. The beds and rooms are fine and the breakfast is decent too. A little far from the nearest Tram station (Hoekenes), but manageable. The only complaint I have about this hotel is concerning the staff. From the front desk attendants, to the wait staff in the restaurant to the housekeeping. Rude, barely there and not afraid to roll their eyes, argue or make the guests feel like crap. I not only experienced this, but also witnessed this to other guest unrelated to me or my stay. Perhaps no one like their job or no one there like people, but whichever the case may be, made an otherwise pleasant stay a little less enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful - but i wouldn't choose to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Emilinie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend with a group of friends. Rooms were clean but basic. No tea or coffee making facilities which is a bit bad even for budget accommodation these days. Especially when you consider that coffee downstairs was â‚¬2.50 and the staff had trouble distinguishing between coffee and espresso and i ended up with espresso 2 out of 3 times. The staff when they were around were helpful, but sort of thin on the ground. Breakfast was good and buffet style but at nearly â‚¬18 once tax is added (which they don't mention when your eating) you are better off going into the town and eating there. There is a bar but its only open for short periods and again.. the staff really weren't around to serve you. As for location - the metro is an easy 10 minute walk and runs regularly and takes about 25 minutes to get to Dam Square and the Red Light District, but if you are only in town for a short while you are better off staying closer to the centre of town and paying a bit extra as if you want to stay out late if you need a taxi its around â‚¬30-35.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible hotel with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: gibsubdiving
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place with a group of friends who were celebrating a stag weekend in Amsterdam. It's probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. At Â£129 a night, all you got was a shoe box size room. At its widest point, I could touch the walls on both sides with my hands. No matter what room you were given , all were extremely noisy, making sleeping a mission. There is no double glazing so you hear absolutely everything that goes on in the street. Because it's located right in the heart of the tourist district, you're guaranteed not to sleep well. The staff are extremely rude and unhelpful. When I arrived there were two separate customers arguing with the manager/receptionist. I asked an asian lady/receptionist if she would take a photo of us and was rudely told "NO". I certainly won't be going back there again. On the other hand, I would certainly recommend The Renaissance, which is located in an ideal place, the place is modern and the service impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Do not choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgood2011
Reviews.Content: When I read that the staff was rude, I thought that they were rude by american standards. By staying at the hotel I now know that they are rude and unpleasant by any standard. If you wonder why the hotel staff is so unpleasant and rude, it is probably because of all the complaints they get. At check-out they tried to charged us twice for a dinner at the hotel(not recommendable at all, the waitress was more or less pissed off at us because we came 21.16 to our 21.15 reservation (they close at 22.00)), then they charged us for breakfast every day (we only had it twice), and they charge â‚¬ 13,50 for a breakfast which is mostly at the "bowl of cornflakes"-level(!). You really need to investigate what they charge you for at the check out. We asked several times before would tell us why they were charging us so much. I sincerely believe that this is intentional, and that this is the reason for the deposit. The will try to swindle you as much as possible, and you can not do anything about it since they have reserved your money. The price for breakfast is off every standard(rip-off), and they don't tell you the price if you don't ask explicitly. We asked several questions about the breakfast, and at a normal hotel they would then tell you the price. But not here. If you have to stay here, make sure that you do not eat here or need any assistance at any time. And the pillows are huge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: AAM17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago the hotel it self was nice, but it was far from the main attractions, which some people may like. the room was nice nothing spectacular but nice. very nice resturant. id return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great price. Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: jase87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Tulip Inn, Amsterdam City West for two nights and found it to be charming, comfortable, great value and had great staff. From Schilpol Airport, get the 353 bus to Oeverpad costing 2.60EUR for a single. The hotel is ten minutes walking to the right of the stop, you'll walk across a small bridge and then take the second left and the hotel is straight in front of you. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and they all spoke excellent English. Yes, you pay a 50EUR deposit but you get it back on departure. There is a great bar and restaurant, very trendily decorated and free high speed Internet access as well as a fitness suite. It isn't as far from the City Centre as some reviewers claim. Ask at reception and they will give you a free map on how to get to the tram stop (about 10 mins walking from hotel) and get Tram 17, destination Centraal Station and it takes 15-20mins. You can get off at Dam Square at you are right in the heart of Amsterdam! We were a bit wary about getting back but night buses run every half hour from midnight to 6am from outside the Station, so we were able to party to half 4 or 5am and get back no problem! Oh, while you're in the Red Light District, check out Bar Excalibur and Grand Cafe Remember, both very different but great atmosphere and music. When we return to Amsterdam, we'll stay at Tulip Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and area, but a tram journey away from the busy Amsterdam City Centre”
Reviews.Author: babygyal1989
Reviews.Content: Massive room, could of slept 4 and there was only 2 of us, best nights sleep in the bed! Has tv with english channels. Breakfast was amazing, so much to choose from and it was all fresh. Beware that when you arrive at the hotel you will have to give 50euro deposit, we didnt have it on us so instead they kept our passports untill we left, it all went smoothly. Lovely lakes around the hotel and a few blocks of flats which was very quiet. 5 min walk to tram stop which takes you into main Amsterdam (7euros full day pass which can also be used on the buses) Great little shopping centre around the corner, everything was cheap because your away from the tourist shops. Would stay here again, but dont bother if you dont want to travel in and out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to which I'd deffinately return”
Reviews.Author: xanzer
Reviews.Content: The Tulip was a great place to stay. The rooms were tidy, the breakfast was nice and the staff were helpful. When i arrived for only a short 4 night break the hotel was very quiet but started to get more busy as we left so maybe that could be a factor as to why i had such a easy stay. The location seems to be the only downside to this hotel for some people. The tram service is excellent, The No.17 will put you just a few minutes from the hotel. I visited a friend who was staying in a hotel in the centre of Amsterdm and the noise there was terrible, he got little sleep at night and as anyone who has been will know that Amsterdam will take it out of you and a good nights sleep is the most important part of your stay. The Tulip was very peacefull , i heard no outside noise during my stay, the shower was very warm and the beds were comfy. A lot of people have said about the area being dodgy, well.... yes it doesn't look like a place i would live but the City centre is where the action happens (Although the local area around the hotel provided me with anything i needed) I'd deffinately go back, the 15-20 min tram is worth it for the comfort of a great nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out and staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: Cobra53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour, therefore cannot comment on price. A long way from the city â€“ too far/expensive for a cab and about an hour on the tram. We had two extremely bad experiences with catering staff. Firstly while waiting for service at bar we were ignored 3 times by staff walking by. When we requested seervice we told to â€œwaitâ€�. Later that night we purchased a bottle of wine at the bar and took it to our table, a staff member who said he was the manager stormed up and without any questions ripped the bottle out of my grasp and said â€œyou cannot drink that hereâ€� suggesting that we had bought our own wine into the restaurant. When he finally allowed us to talk and we explained it was purchased in the hotel he refused to apologise. He was also one of the staff that ignored us earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive lodging, no good for city tourists”
Reviews.Author: JTH_BE
Reviews.Content: We've booked the Tulip to explore Amsterdam for a few days. As we travelled by car, finding the hotel wasn't much of a problem. Due to the parking situation we decided to switch to the tram to go downtown. The 10 minute walk isn't much of a problem either, but you do see some shady figures walking there at night... Anyway, our room was of good size, bed was good, bathroom with walk-in shower, so far all great. The window (onto a costruction site - this is no criticism on the hotel!) was dirty (stains all over it from people leaning against it with their foreheads). We mentioned this at the frontdesk and they promised to take care of it. Well, within three days they did not. We complained about it twice. It is not a big deal to us, but customer service shows in the small things... and calling up the cleaning personell to tell them to swipe the window in room xyz takes what - 30 seconds? The hotel wasn't overcrowded and front desk staff didn't look too busy. Breakfast buffet was good, plenty stuff to chose from, ample space in the dining room. For people who look for inexpensive accomodation and don't mit the tram trip to see Amsterdam do go ahead and book here. Should we return to AMS, we'll shell out a few more Euros and book somewhere else, nearer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - the trade off between comfortable room and central location is worth it”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamerUk
Reviews.Content: I ask for a clean, comfortable, warm but not hot room with a decent shower. I like free internet, a bar and a restaurant. Ideally, there is a tram outside tthe door and that is the only shortcoming of this hotel. This hotel is in a lovely green part of Amsterdam but off the beaten track. Plan your route on public transport and you are fine. I am likely to use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful & Useless”
Reviews.Author: Ramone1978
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last resort due to the city being over run with vistors to an International Broadcasting Exhibition. We took the tram as instructed on the directions we received with the booking which landed us in the Bronx. The instructions then said 'the hotel is 10 minutes walk from the tram' - ten minutes in which direction??? We finally found the hotel after asking dodgy looking locals (it's not in a nice area at all) and when we tried to check in the miserable lady on reception said they had doubled book many rooms including ours and that we would be transferred to another. She wouldnt tell us how, when, where or even what the other hotel was called. We were told to wait outside and would be called when a taxi had come for us. We waited for a while with various taxi drivers asking if we were the next to be transferred but because of the lack of information given to us, we didnt have a clue. The afore mentioned lady on reception (Stefanie) rudely told us to wait outside and finally we got in a cab. This ended up being the wrong cab and he tried charging us which we spent half an hour sorting out over the radio in a layby. Once sorted we ended up at the Dorint hotel near the airport which was a 1000 times better and actually was the silver lining to our black cloud of an experience with the Tulip Hotel. Avoid this hotel at all costs. Avoid Amsterdam taxis at all costs too. Stay close to the centre (its worth paying extra) and use the excellent trams and trains instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the west of the city”
Reviews.Author: ianfleming
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the main CBD of Amsterdam but is a good hotel at the right price. The tram is only abiut 5 minutes walk from the hotel and takes about 20 minutes to the CBD. The rooms are a good size and breakfast is very good. There was 4 adults in our party staying in 2 rooms with all the necessary facilities. We were able to get a taxi from the airport for 31.00 euros where a shuttle was 15.00euros per person. A 24 hour public transport ticket is available from the front desk for 7 euros which gives you access to trams, buses and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rjspurling
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times just for the convenience. It's usually for one day so I put up with the horrible service at the reception. They never smile and they're not very helpful. The only department that's worth a compliment is one of the waiters during the night shift in the restaurant. I've eaten dinner there twice and he is the only one that actually smiles and seems to enjoy working there. I've posted some photos so you can see the basic layout. However, I do agree with other reviewers: - rooms are old and outdated, like the building and the neighborhood. - this hotel is in basically a hostel. - bathrooms are dirty and no matter which room you get, it always has a bad smell. - bed isn't comfortable and the air conditioner works, but gives off an odd smell. - there is wifi you can pay or if you have Ethernet cable, it's free Now, the WORST part: - the neighborhood is not safe at all. If you're traveling alone, donâ€™t stay here. - Your car is not safe. My car was recently vandalized, which was parked in the hotel parking lot. Both of my windows were broken and I had nothing visible to see inside of my car. I had to file a police report & they said the assailants probably watched me park the car. They probably saw that I was putting away my GPS and noticed that I had a different national license plate. The police also think there were 2 assailants as they broke both windows. - the police even said Reimerswaalstraat, where the hotel is located, has one of HIGHEST CAR BREAK-IN CRIME IN THE AREA. In all, I would say pay the extra 15 or 20 Euros a night and go somewhere else. I always knew this area wasn't safest so I took extra caution, but if they're standing around targeting the people parking in the hotel, then you have no chance. Far worse, the receptionist donâ€™t care. They acted like this happens every other day. So, STAY SOMEWHERE BUT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DepartureBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tulip Inn Amsterdam City West for two nights. It was a very unpleasant experience due to poor customer service and a very poor location. First, the customer service experience is awful to say the least. We booked a package via the hotel's own website. When we checked in, we were told we did not book a package but were paying a regular rack rate. During almost 45 mins of discussion with desk staff and manager, we were confronted with a 'No' at almost every request and a stubborn refusal to accept the facts (the desk staff admitted that our rate was the same as the 'package rate', but did not include various amenities like transport cards and breakfast as advertised) and they did not know what our package contained - the email confirmation we received and showed them just said 'Hotel Package A' with no details. Rather than make this right immediately, we had to spend 45 mins with them and ended up missing a nice dinner out as most places in Amsterdam stop serving early (usually by 21:30-22 at night). Ultimately they admitted their mistake and tried to make it right by compensating us with free drink vouchers, which they later refused to honor. Management really needs to work on training their staff to problem solve on the spot and address customer expectations better. Finally, the location was really really bad. At one time, the neighborhood was probably green and calm, but apparently they have built some 'social housing' nearby with the result that the area feels really dangerous with groups of men hanging about in the parks and in front of different shops. As an example, the hotel, in cooperation with local police department, puts out these pamphlets and neon signs to put in your car advising you to **empty** it of any contents so there won't be any smash and grab incidents while you park your overnight. No protected parking and no onsight security other than a few cameras that the - unattentive - desk staff can watch in the corner. They have apparently even installed security doors in the front lobby - the inner door will not open until the outer door is fully closed - like they install in banks and nice jewelry stores to prevent robberies. To call this location 'Amsterdam' is being generous. This is one of the far western suburbs (the Amsterdam city limit sign is about 100m from the hotel) and it takes, on a good trip, 30 mins to get to 'central' Amsterdam via tram, where most tourists are interested in going. The room was acceptably clean - but not beyond. The bed sheets had some inconspicuous tears in the corners, etc. Room was generally quiet, but staff was not conscientious enought not to slam doors, etc. in morning when starting their routine as other people have noted in their reviews. I would not stay here again, and the only reason we did stay was because they accepted dogs (which we travel with all the time). We will leave the dog at home and choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Side by side twin beds?”
Reviews.Author: nicoleannette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at least 30 minutes by tram to central Amsterdam. The area was very residental and quiet with a view of canals from our window. Next time we are in Amsterdam we'd probably stay much closer to the city. Maybe it would be faster by bike? They have bright yellow bike rentals - a good idea so people from a distance can see you are a tourist and maybe unfamiliar with biking there. But we didn't use it. The rooms were nicely sized and clean but sparse. Our "king sized bed" was really 2 twins pushed together. Is that the norm? The bedding was also very low budget ikea. Thin white sheets with a very thin white comforter on top, not really large enough if you move in your sleep. The bathroom was also all white, inexpensive looking and nothing special. Almost like a dorm, no personality. There were a few places to drink and eat at nearby but most were closed early. We had brunch one morning at the hotel and it was great! Someone also wrote this place was far from the airport - that is not true. We took a taxi to the airport and it was cheap and a quick ride maybe 10 minutes. It is far from Central Station so getting to or from the train station is at least 30 minutes maybe more.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel... definitely not the worst I've seen!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonTeachergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in April with a large group of students. This was our last stop on a ten-day tour of France, Belgium and the Netherlands. I would say this was one of the hotels the kids liked the most (the others being Lille and Paris). Rooms with lovely beds (I had a king-size bed), fairly nice bathrooms (shower stall though, no bathtub), and decent service. Lots of selection for dinner and breakfast. Elevators a bit strange (one button calls one elevator, as opposed to first available), but some nice big conference tables in alcoves off the ground and first floors. A fitness centre, seemed nice from what I saw. Bit of a crap neighbourhood, but one of our chaperones was able to negotiate the tram from downtown Amsterdam to the hotel with no trouble. Internet's not free, but it is available. Staff seemed nice. One critique is that we had booked wake-up calls for both days (especially on the day we had to catch our plane) and neither of them came through on time, they were more than a half-hour late. Otherwise, we definitely stayed in worse during our trip! (Watch out for the memory books in each room; NOT appropriate for kids!)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, BAD area!”
Reviews.Author: Vlamings
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok - not the best, but you get what you pay for. Staff were friendly enough, but amenities quite basic. HOWEVER - you don't want to walk around outside as it is really not a good or safe neighbourhood (Google earth streetview it). We walked from the hotel towards the tram stop and were watched by a gang of youths. Shortly afterwards, two of them on a scooter tried to snatch my handbag. They failed, but it was scary. They made no attempt to hide their faces and were obviously not beginners. My bag was solidly attached to my arm. We reported it to the police and were informed that it is not an uncommon occurence. I was also told by another police officer that car crime is also high in that area. That leaves taxis as a safer form of transport - yeah right. Amsterdam taxis - they are a story in themself. So, not bad hotel but wouldn't stay there again because of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not an Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JAC_Plymouth
Reviews.Content: A large, clean and comfortable (if dated) room but much too far from Schipol to make it a viable overnight stay. Info states there is an airport shuttle bus....but beware, this will cost you 14 euros each way, per person, which makes it an expensive stay for a couple or family. We opted to take local transport which was an excellent alternative.....but think again if you have lots of luggage or a large family to organise. Catch No 192 from right outside airport, then ask the driver to tell you when to get off and change to the No 63 (get off after three stops). This delivers you to within 80 metres of the hotel. Total cost is 2.6 euros per person each way....just remember to zap your ticket as you get off the first bus, or you'll be charged twice! The drivers speak excellent English so just ask for help!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: EmmaC1989
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Tulip Inn, The staff were extremely friendly and helpful without bein too in your face, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, the smell of Canabis is usual in the morning and where I found it very pleasent some people might not, I would definatly stay there again. A very pleasant place to stay in a very plesanrt city :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrycat1
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel, rooms and beds comfortable. Reception staff very helpful. The hotel is a little way out of the centre of the city a half hour tram ride and we would recommend a sat nav to find the hotel if driving. However we would suggest Not dinning at the hotel in the evening, expensive and tasted like boil in the bag. The breakfast was fine although we often had to wait for the food trays to be topped up and queue for the coffee machines.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becksybaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel in an airmiles deal, the room cost Â£80 for the night & was not worth the money. It is very far out of the city in an area called Osdorp (later described to us like going to London & staying in a hotel in Brixton) The bathroom smelt like an old people's home & you could hear everyone walkin down the corridors & shutting doors. On the plus side breakfast was quite nice, a buffet with all your usual cooked food as well as fuit & cereals. We paid 40 euro's to get from the airport to the hotel in a taxi so a train may be cheaper (we get there late at night so they weren't running) We also bought a 4 day tram pass for the reception which was 18 Euro's which we used loads. The quickest way to get from the hotel to town it is a 10 min walk to the tram stop, then take tram 17 & change to tram one to get into Leidseplein which is where the nightlife starts the tram ride is about 20 mins in total.

Reviews.Title: “Way too far away from center, not attractive”
Reviews.Author: MartaCatarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a weekend trip in the Tulip Inn Amsterdam City West hotel. It is located in the surroundings of Amsterdam, next to a block-houses which are partly demolished. It takes appr. 10 minutes to walk to the tram station and then appr. 40 min. to the Center of Amsterdam. The rooms were ok, something small missing here and there (tv not working probebly, hot water sent on and off) and you could hear quite clearly the noice from the corridor. The breakfast was ok , except there were plates missing or not enough spoons, etc. The staff was nice. But I wouldn't recommend this hotel, if you are staying just a couple of days in Amsterdam and want to spend your time in the sights of the city, and not in the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame it's not in the center”
Reviews.Author: Holly_82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2008 with a friend and we went for a cheap city break. We looked at Trip Advisor and thought it seemed like a good deal. It was a pain in the neck to find - we're usually not that bad at working out where places are, but we had to ask 4 different people where the hotel was - we had brought a map and tried to phone the hotel but the number didn't seem to be working. The tram stop is about 10 minutes walk away from the hotel and it took about 25-30 minutes from the center. The area the hotel is situated in isn't *great* but it's not the worst in the world. When we arrived, the man on reception was very polite and extremely helpful, he told us how to get to Artis zoo and other attractions and sold us tram tickets, we went to our room and were pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and functional - no frills, but no problems. The view wasn't amazing, but it was quiet, comfortable and there was a lock on the door. The first night we were there, we ate in the hotel and the food wasn't amazing so I would reccomend eating elsewhere, however it was food and it didn't kill us :-) The fact it is a distance from the center did start to get annoying on the second day as we were tired so were thinking we should have picked somewhere more central, however - we would have had to pay more money, and therefore accept there is a compromise to make. If I went back to Amsterdam, I would probably not stay at this hotel again, simply due to the fact it's not really situated near any major attractions and would spend a bit more money to get somewhere closer to the center. However for someone on a tight budget who doesn't mind travelling 40 minutes to the center of Amsterdam I would certainly reccomend it. Nothing wrong with the hotel at all, and polite / helpful reception.

Reviews.Title: “If you do the math ..”
Reviews.Author: EvilHerb
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel at all.We got the Amsterdam at 6am in the morning so I asked for an early check in. The man at the front desk told me that they can check me in early for 20 euro.I agreed to have it added to my bill so we could get to our room and sleep a couple hours.Well,he sent us to a room that was not cleaned from the previous guest yet,so I brought all the bags back down to the desk and they did provide a room that was clean finally.A least I was not charged at the end.They were good about that.I ordered a room with 1 bed( Queen ? )for 2 people( my wife and I ) and I was kind of disappointed to find that it was two twin mattresses pushed together , so there was this annoying gap down middle of the bed which made it impossible for us to sleep close.So,yes the bed sucked.The location of the hotel is a bit far from Central but I didn't mind the walk to the tram stop . Its is about a 10 min walk to the Tram and about a 20-25 min tram ride to Central Station . My main complaint with the hotel came on the morning we checked out . The night before , I had paid for the hotels "Airport Shuttle " to take my wife and I to the Airport the next morning at 10:15 . The next morning I checked out at 10 am and the guy who checked us out says to me "The airport shuttle is waiting for you right outside ". So I check out and walk out front . No shuttle in sight. I walk back to the desk and ask where the shuttle is? He looks outside and says "Oh no , It looks like they left".He said another shuttle would be along soon .No shuttle after an hour wait. I had to take a cab and almost missed my flight! I did the math and the few hundred I spent on Transportation ( 2 cab rides and 7 day Tram pass = about $340 ) , I could have paid a little more for a room in Central A-dam and not had to take a cab or tram at all . Next time I will .

Reviews.Title: “Great value, a bit far out!”
Reviews.Author: rahulpat
Reviews.Content: First, the bad news: It will be 1/2 an hour by tram from Station Centraal (and the "sites) to the stop where the hotel is...but it has less to do with the distance and more with the fact that Ams. trams are pretty slow. The Western suburbs are a quiet and pretty residential area, so not a lot to do there. Then, the good news: Huge, clean and modern rooms for unbelievably bargain prices! The front desk staff is extremely helpful, speaks excellent English and really will help you during your stay. They sell public transportation passes and so forth, too. Considering the zone central is over-run by rowdy and intoxicated tourists/backpackers at night, I was kind of pleased to be in a hotel outside that area. * The nightbus also stops there on weekends after midnite and there is a bus 5-10 mins which goes straight to Schipol.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Speerhead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a Cosmos Tour . We found it to be very clean,staff were friendly . It was close to public transport. It has a good bar for after dinner drinks & breakfast was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: LCM-HK
Reviews.Content: Hi I am from Hong Kong~ I have been to Amsterdam for 4 days in July 2008. I find the Tulip inn city west is quite good. Some people complain the location is too far. However, I think the transport is good enough, I go to the city centre by Tram 17, (just 5-7 mins walk to the tram stop) and the journey is about 30 mins to the city centre. the hotel is quite near the airport actually On day 1, I take the train from Airport to Amsterdam Lelyln station (about 5 mins, 2.8 Euro) and then change the bus no. 63 at Lelyln station to the hotel (about 10 -15 mins) And the bus station is quite near to the hotel. (within 1 min walk) If you take the train to Amsterdam Lelyln and change bus no. 63 to the hotel, it is cheaper and faster than you go to Central station and take tram 17. Whenever we wanna go to city centre, we can take tram 17. On day 3, we go to Rotterdam and Den Haag, we take bus no. 63 to the Amsterdam Lelyln station, and take the train to Den Haag. Again, it is faster and cheaper if you take the train from Amsterdam Lelyln station to Den Haag (35 - 40 mins) than you take the train from Central station. If you do not only stay in Amsterdam centre, but also visit other famous cities like Den Haag or Rotterdam. I think Tulip inn city west is quite convenient actually. Moreover, the surrounding of the hotel is quite beautiful, clean and peaceful. It is really different from the city centre of Amsterdam. And there is a famous building located next to the hotel is really wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “a gud hotel with gud price”
Reviews.Content: As every one is complaining the distanc from the city center , i dont agree . If can spare 20 minutes , it is good enough travelling time from cetral to the hotel. Rooms are very good in size and toilets too.coffee and tea is complimentry , this is in mid of residential area ,so one can get he real feel of amsterdam life (some thing beyond RLD). There no problem of food as there are lots of option within a short walk as well as in hotel also. go for it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from city”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCart
Reviews.Content: Booked from booking.com. The hotel is decent, friendly staff but as others mentioned, it is rather far from the city center. Approx 25 min tram ride, on top of a 5-7 minute walk to the tram stop. On the positive side, the tram runs fairly frequently and the hotel is not too far from the airport. A taxi ride from the city center to the hotel is approximately EUR 10-12

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Youngmcgill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tulip Inn City West from 1st Feb 2008 to 3rd Feb 2008. We visited Amsterdam with 4 friends who had booked a hotel closer to the city. The hotel itself was fine, clean, very friendly and helpful staff, spacious rooms and good TV channels. The only down side is the location. Im not adverse to having to travel a bit to get to the centre, particularly given that we got a good price from hotels.com however, it would have been much better booking a hotel nearer the city. When we arrived it cost 25 euros by taxi from Central Station to the hotel. Be weary of the taxis, they tend to try and shaft you as they will either give you the option of a fixed price and no meter, or use the meter but take you on a detour around the city! One time the taxi cost us 30 euro and we were already half way to the hotel, after an argument with the taxi driver, he cut it to 15! The trams are a good way of getting round but its still pretty awkward. The tram stop is probably a 15 minute walk from the hotel, which isnt too far but it is when its very cold and windy. Particularly at night time when you have to change trams etc to get home. Its probably one of those things when you know where to go it would be easier but as we were only there a few days we didnt rally have time to understand it! The hotel is set in what can only be described as a housing estate with nothing other than a few shops nearby - only a spar! So be prepared that once your back at the hotel, your pretty much there as theres nothing much else to do there! Its difficult to fault the hotel itself its just the location. I gelt that it sort of spoilt our weekend slightly as we were constantly aware that it would take about an hour to get back to the hotel at night unless we wanted to pay a fortune for taxis. Its a lovely hotel but I couldnt recommend it to weekend tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: triget
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is an amazing city to visit!!! i know plenty have people have said this hotel is too far out i disagree!!! on the tram journey to town u get to see many little restaurants and bars that you wudnt have otherwise seen if stayin more centrally! and how cud u complain with trams every 10mins and a nite bus that goes every half hour!! all this for 14euros for 3 days travel!! the hotel was comfy and clean!! wud definately recommend for people on a budget!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: bud89
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel if you're on a budget. It does take about 25 minutes to get downtown on the tram, plus another 5-10 minutes to walk to the tram stop. There are only a few restaurants around the hotel, so plan on eating downtown before heading back for the night. Area around the hotel is fairly dark at night, few streetlights on a couple of the streets you must walk to get back to the hotel from the tram stop. Felt pretty safe though, didn't have any problems with anyone in the area. You will walk past a local italian restaurant on the way to the tram stop, it's pretty good, cash only. Rooms were pretty average, nice size rooms for europe, but pretty plain. Hotel restaurant was ok, but very pricey. All in all, not a bad place if you're trying to save money from the more expensive hotels downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable but too far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: travelgoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight and it was very comfortable. Spacious and clean rooms and pleasant staff. The view wasn't too die for unless you're a huge fan of concrete blocks. It is about 25 minutes from the central station by tram and we lost our way the first time. If you're looking for a warm comfortable, not-too-expensive hotel to stay in, this is a great place. But if you want to experience the buzz of living near the city centre, I'd suggest you stay somewhere else. PS: If you do get the I Amsterdam card, don't bother buying cheese from the Cheese Gift Shop at the Magna Centre, its an absolute rip off. They give you a 'discount' on a four-pack of cheese, claiming its 35 Euros (they sell it to you for about 26). There's an excellent cheese shop at Schipol airport that sells the same pack of cheese (fresher though) for cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: td1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tulip Inn City West from August 26-29th 2007 for a short citybreak in Amsterdam. The best way to get to the hotel from Schiphol airport is via the shuttle taxi service bookable in the airport lobby (19 Euros each return) which is a ten/fifteen minute ride. The staff at the hotel were all excellent, being friendly, helpful and polite at all times, especially regarding transport. The room was great for a three-star, with air conditioning, tea and coffee facilities, a safe, multi-lingual television channels and plenty of space. It was spotless upon arrival and the towels and linen were changed during the stay. Whilst we could hear other people in the corridors occasionally, the hotel was generally very quiet and peaceful. As others have mentioned, the Tulip Inn City West is a little out of the centre of Amsterdam, but the surrounding area is pretty quiet and we certainly never fealt uneasy walking around after dark. Getting into Amsterdam is really easy, with a five-minute walk to the nearest tram stop then a 30 minute ride to Centraal station. The 13.50 Euro 3 day pass available from reception is well worth the money. We chose to eat whilst out and about so cannot comment on the standard of food offered at the hotel. The only improvement we could suggest would be the provision of a bath, as our room only had a shower but this is a very small gripe. All in all, we thouroughly enjoyed our stay and will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: randbcraib
Reviews.Content: I chose the Tulip Inn West as we were needing a night in Amsterdam before returning to ferry at Ijmuiden and this hotel was on the correct side of Amsterdam. The staff were very helpful and as our room was not ready when we arrived we registered and they stored our luggage whilst we went into Amsterdam for the day. The tram journey in and out was fine but I am not sure I would have been so keen to do it at night as the walk back to the hotel was through a rather rough area. Our room was spacious and clean and the bed was very large and comfortable. We ate at the hotel in the evening and the meal was fine and service good. For our needs the Tulip served an adequate purpose.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel bad info on shuttle”
Reviews.Author: xm
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 15th of May here because we had a 5 hour layover from Nice to Amsterdam to LAX. I called ahead of time and was informed that there would be a shuttle avalable to pick us up and take us back in the morning. Well we arrive 10:30 pm and it turns out service finished at 9:30, so we ended up taking a taxi that cost us 50.00 euro - aka $65.00 US!!!! So we arrive and I had PAID in advanmce thru Orbitz and the guy at the hotel tells me we need to pay, I show him my Orbitz receipt and thank goodness I paid with AMEX, because I will fight it if we get double charged. Anyways, so since the taxi took all euros, I asked if the hotel had a ATM, and he said no. We would have to walk about 15 minutes to a mall for cash. I ask for the shuttle info, he points over to a stand and the first shuttle does not go out until 7:30 am and we had to be at the airport at 6am???!!!. So boys and girls, the moral of the story iis that its a clean hotel but they should be more clear about the shuttle service and not be considered an airport hotel. If I would to do this all over I would stay with what I am familiar, a best western, mercure, sheraton hotel that does have a shuttle service all night and day long because it caters to airport/layover clients.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blooster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is best described as "ok". Location wise, it's really not very good at all. You're only about a 10 minute walk to the nearest tram (Hoekenes) and these arrive pretty regularly - takes about 25 mins to get into town. However, the area around there is not good and walking to the hotel after the dark was pretty nerve-wracking!! No incidents, but not pleasant walking through blocks of high-rise flats. We actually arrived quite late and our room had gone, but luckily for us we were given a suite. Great! Hold back with your expectations - the suite is on the top floor and simply is a larger room containing an additional double bed (looked like a couple of z-beds placed together). It was clean and tidy and had all the usual things you'd expect. In terms of a room, I couldn't complain and the bed was very comfy. We booked the airport shuttle to get back, however, when I checked, the woman had failed to tell the shuttle bus we needed to be picked up! I complained and we were given a taxi (which the hotel paid for) - still, very unimpressive service. I didn't have the breakfast so can't comment. Overall, not a bad hotel - does the basics well, but use it as a bed for the night and nothing else. Don't pay a lot for it - we searched the internet and got it for about Â£35 a night - probably a good price for what we got, but not worth a great deal more. Does though provide a nice contrast to the over-priced city centre hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EaganTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Tulip Inn City West is located in a more remote location in between many apartment complexes. Shuttle service is available through the common shuttle service at the airport for $10 euros one way. Previous reviews are correct that this building was not designed as a hotel and work needs to be done to upgrade the common areas. The rooms are a pleasant surprise as they are a nice size, good amenities including coffee/tea in the room, nice size bathroom with shower (and a shower curtain), and good quality towels. The walk to the tram takes about 10 minutes and the ride into downtown Amsterdam does take up to 30 minutes. I did not find this a problem as you are a ways outside of the city and the trams ran frequently. Not much near the hotel to see or places to dine so heading into the city is a great idea. Overall an average hotel but for the price we received for an airport hotel it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: DEL8
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed for new years eve (30th dec - 1st jan).when we arrived we had to pay 100 euro's as a deposit. We were not informed about this previous to uor stay. When we checked out, we did not get full amount back because we had to pay city tax!!!!!!!! there was no transport on new years eve after 8pm. when we found that out we thought we would at least be able to have a few drinks in hotel bar, but we cudnt as it closed at 8pm. we were fuming. we were stuck in our room all night. we did not know the hotel was so far away from the main centre of Amsterdam.if we went to amsterdam we definately wouldnt stay there again because of the distance away from everything. the ONLY upside was the cleanliness of the room. although when it was raining the rain leaked through bottom of windows onto window sill. We also ordered a pizza through room service. it cost 10 euro's plus a 3 euro surcharge. When it came it was a microwavable one. it was a plate of soggy, doughy, tomatoey mush. yuk!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for price.”
Reviews.Author: Roshman
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel in a residential area, a tram's ride from the city. Staff very friendly and helpful. Double room was spacious, clean and tidy. Towels changed daily, sheets every other day. We travelled as a couple, but this hotel is well suited for families. Restaurant for evening meal (used on first night) was reasonably priced with a small but varied choice. Breakfast as expected from a 3* hotel, but was optional. Would definately usethis hotel for a repeat visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “clean and tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: t.i.n.a.31
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Tulip Inn City West. It is a bit far out from the centre, about a 30 min tram ride, but this gave us the opportunity to see the sights of Amsterdam that we would have otherwise missed, also the tram ride is reasonable at a couple of euros and transport is very frequent. The hotel is very clean and tidy and the reception staff are helpful. We even received a complimentary upgrade on arrival to a superior room as we were celebrating our anniversary. As we stayed during an unusually hot period, the air conditioned room was appreciated. This is a pleasant reasonable hotel in a quiet location and the only negative comment I could make is that it is a bit of a distance from the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Solid middleclass accomodation for good rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a public holiday weekend because we didnâ€™t want to pay the exaggerated prices in the city center. We found a bargain price on the internet. My total vote would be: nothing fancy, but a solid middleclass accomodation and I guess well above average compared to city center hotels in the same price range. Location: A bit out of the way in a satellite city residential area (Osdorp). Easy to reach by car, plus they have an airport shuttle too. Free parking in front of the hotel (a big plus in Amsterdam too). It is an easy 10 min walk to the nearest tram station (Hoekenes), tram 17 takes you in 30 mins into the city (Dam, Main Station), the last tram runs past midnight. A 15-section strippenkaart can be bought for 6.70 Euro at the reception. Youâ€™ll need to validate 3 sections for a ride into the city, so it is good for 5 trips. Staff at the reception is friendly and helpful. Rooms are ready at 2 pm. We arrived at 1 pm, so they stored our luggage. Rooms are spacey and clean, typical middleclass hotel interieur, although no minibar. TV has international programs (CNN, BBC, German) as well. Breakfast is with 14 Euros per person quite overpriced, and selection is a bit limited and disappointing for that price. On the other hand, if you eat late and plenty, you can survive the day trip w/o lunch easily. Canâ€™t say anything positive about the bar. They offered Frozen Pina Coladas which had no alcohol taste to it and the barkeeper shrugged: â€žIt comes out of this machine, we just add the water....â€œ. A second try with ordering a Caipirinha was even worse: how can you do that without the lime wedges?

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad bad bad, after a second honeymoon we decided to come back to Amsterdam, unfortanetly was a Bank holiday and all the hotels were booked. The trip to the hotel Tullip Inn City West took 1 hour by tram - don't believe in hotel site that says 30 min. The tram station is about 10 min walking and the is no sight to the hotel. The neighborhoud is terrible! They gave us a dissable room, w/ a large rowl in the cortin. We ask to reception to fix it and they didn't do it. We paid EUR 145 for a bad hotel w/no refrigerator in room and no room service. Bad hotel !!!!! Never spend your money here. If I could I'll make a formal complain about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel as part of a European tour. We expected a tourist grade room but were pleasently surprised by the size and cleanliness of the room. The hotel is not centrally located but there is tram service nearby. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angeliki_Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tulip Inn from the 24th to the 27th of December. The area was good, about 10 min walk from the high street and a 15min tram journey from the city centre. You can take the train from Schipol aeroport and then the tram from lelylland (take the line AWAY from the City centre). Public transport in Amsterdam is really easy and the people are always happy to help. We were a bit concerned when we asked about the hotel in Schipol Information desk as the answer was "Wow, the tulip inn west!Ah..", but don't be phased! The hotel is about a 10 walk from the tram stop on the local high street. When we were visiting all the shops were closed because of the Christmas holidays, but we could see that there was a lot of amenities there. The room was big for anyone's standards and clean. The bathroom was on the small side with a large shower, no bath. The restaurant offered good priced meals and the bar is very good with good prices concidering it's a hotel. The staff are happy to help day or night. Invest in a 3 day public transport pass and take both tram roots from the hotel to the city centre. One is slightly longer but goes through the real city bits (poorer neighberhoods).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful (but a bit out of the way)”
Reviews.Author: Pooy
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam on December 16th 2005 and stayed for a weekend with some girls from work. The hotel was extremely good value as we only paid Â£116 for the hotel with flights included from Expedia - what a bargain! The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly, speak excellent English and are very helpful. The room I stayed in was a non-smoking room and there were no smells of smoke in the room or corridor. The room was large, clean and had a hairdryer fitted into the bathroom. The shower was powerful and hot and the TV had many channels including MTV. Although the hotel is slightly out from the centre and there is a 15 minute walk to the tram stop then a 20 minute journey to Dam Square, it was reasonably priced and comfortable. I would prefer to stay nearer the Square next time I visit as you tend to spend a lot of time travelling to and from the hotel. I would not recommend families staying in this hotel due to the walk to the tram stop which is accessed via the side of the canal which is poorly lit and pitch black at night. However, if you want a girly (or lads) weekend this hotel is affordable, in a quiet area and Amsterdam is simply fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Tulipn Inn Amsterdam West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Tulip Inn Amsterdam City West. The room was large, comparable to American hotels. Comfortable bed and clean room. The staff was polite and efficient. A simple 30 minute tram ride from the city center and a five minute walk from Hoekenes stop on the #17 tram. The location is in a quiet residential area, which is great after a long day walking through Amsterdam. I recommend this hotel and will stay here upon my return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean Rooms at Tulip Inn City West”
Reviews.Author: skizate
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, The staff was very friendly and helpful/informative. They also have passes for Tramlines/buslines that are 13 Euros for a 72 Hour pass and small maps of surrounding area. They also offered a Airport shuttle service for 11 Euros (which is alot cheaper than 30-40 dollar cab fare from the airport) Now the room itself was modest, comparable to say a Motel 6, or Best Western Inn back here in the States. The carpet did have a large stain on it but I could have cared less. The beds were nice and warm, Bathroom was a nice size. and the maid service was efficent promintly there to clean your room by 10:30 am (lol a little to early if you party as much as i did lol) The tram station is about a 5-10min walk along a canal almost infront of the hotel. Unless you walk around and down pass the shops that takes about 15mins depending on how fast you walk. TIP.. BEWARE OF THE BIKE LANE AT NIGHT as I had a hard time distinguishing one from the other. and was almost run over numerous times by Bikers. lol Now the Location of this hotel is some what far from Centraal Station. about 20-40 mins depending on stops and tram capacity. If coming from Centraal Station just hope on the #17 goin to Osdorp or something like that. and get off at the "Hoeknes"(sp?) stop. It is one of the last stops. And for those of you that wonder, "amsterdam style smoking" or Pot smoking is tolerated just so long as you dont "fishbowl" or cloud up the hallways. and you keep the smoking In your room or outside the hotel lobby. I would definately come back to this hotel if staying in AMS again.

HotelInfo.Name: Amsterdam City West
HotelInfo.Address: Reimerswaalstraat 5, Amsterdam 1069 AE, The Netherlands
